page.title: 20ROADS AND TRANSPORT
page.content: The{A689}and the{railway line}run parellel to the River Wear. It carries heavy lorry traffic from the Cement Works at Eastgate, and fluorspar to processing plant at Broadwood. Agricultural goods are transported. It is a{holiday route}to Upper Weardale and the Lake District and to Weardale Ski Centre. {Regular bus services}to Crook and Bishop Auckland pass through, and trip buses covering North East. There are buses to schools at Wolsingham, which are garaged at Frosterley. {Parking facilities}are beside the Village Hall, but are difficult on the main street. {Footpaths,}with traditional rights of way are clearly marked, with stiles . A wooden footbridge and a stone bridge cross the river.
